title: Emerson on the nation - logical extension

content.description:
Question refers to the excerpt below. 

“Free should the scholar be,—free and brave. . . . We have listened too long to the courtly muses of Europe. . . . We will walk on our own feet; we will work with our own hands; we will speak our own minds. Then shall man be no longer a name for pity, for doubt, and for sensual indulgence. . . . A nation of men will for the first time exist.”

Ralph Waldo Emerson, transcendentalist writer, 1837
content.question: Which of the following developments best represents a logical extension of the ideas expressed in the excerpt?

choices.label: The rise of big business in the Gilded Age
The expansion of participatory democracy in the Progressive Era
The rise of Social Darwinism in the late nineteenth century
The increasing support for the annexation of overseas territories

content.answer: The expansion of participatory democracy in the Progressive Era

skill.text: Skill 5.B: Explain how a historical development or process relates to another historical development or process.
